4.description: Recovering from his injuries at the Blackwater, his face badly scarred. His heroic role in the battle is largely unrecognized.

32.description: Forced to marry Sansa Stark as part of his father's political machinations. Treats her kindly despite the unwanted union.

60.description: Arrested after shocking events at the royal wedding feast.

75.description: Demands trial by combat and chooses Oberyn Martell as his champion against Gregor Clegane.

78.description: Escapes King's Landing after killing his father Tywin on the privy. Discovers Shae in Tywin's bed and kills her too.

7.description: Travels with Robb's army, attempting to navigate the complex politics of war while worrying about her scattered children.

28.description: Releases Jaime Lannister hoping to secure Sansa and Arya's freedom, much to everyone's anger.

51.description: Attends the wedding at the Twins as part of reconciliation with House Frey.

9.description: Travels with the Brotherhood Without Banners after escaping Harrenhal. Witnesses their approach to justice.

30.description: Captured by the Hound after he kills Beric Dondarrion in single combat, though Beric is later resurrected again.

52.description: Arrives at the Twins during chaos and confusion.

relationships.Sandor Clegane: Protects her from seeing the worst

74.description: Leaves the Hound to die after he is wounded. Takes passage on a ship bound for Braavos.

relationships.Jaqen H'ghar: Using the iron coin he gave her

6.description: Continues his infiltration of the wildling army, struggling with conflicting loyalties as he grows closer to them.

26.description: Breaks his vows and sleeps with Ygritte, compromising his mission but deepening his human connections.

48.description: Escapes the wildlings and returns to Castle Black to warn of the coming attack. Ygritte pursues him with mixed feelings.

73.description: Defends Castle Black during the massive wildling assault. Shows exceptional leadership and combat skills.

relationships.Ygritte: Dies in his arms during the battle

79.description: Chosen as the new Lord Commander of the Night's Watch in a close election, youngest in history.

8.description: Sails from Qarth with her dragons, now noticeably larger. Begins building a fleet and army to reclaim her birthright.

23.description: Conquers Astapor using the Unsullied army she acquires through trickery, burning the masters with dragonfire.

42.description: Takes Yunkai through siege and negotiation, freeing more slaves and growing her following.

68.description: Conquers Meereen and decides to stay to learn how to rule, rather than immediately sailing for Westeros.

relationships.Barristan Selmy: Reveals his identity as her protector

11.description: Still trapped in King's Landing, now under the 'protection' of the Tyrells who plan to marry her to Willas.

relationships.Olenna Tyrell: Queen of Thorns who shows interest

32.description: Forced to marry Tyrion Lannister, ruining the Tyrell's plans but placing her in a different kind of captivity.

60.description: Present at the royal wedding when chaos erupts. Smuggled away by Ser Dontos.

80.description: Taken to the Vale by Petyr Baelish, who reveals he orchestrated Joffrey's murder. Now disguised as his bastard daughter.
80.role: Hidden in the Vale as Alayne Stone

relationships.Lysa Arryn: Aunt who is jealous of her

1.description: Prisoner of the Starks, chained and defiant. Taunts his captors while being transported by Catelyn and Brienne.

21.description: Loses his sword hand to the Brave Companions. This devastating injury breaks his identity as a warrior.

44.description: Returns to King's Landing fundamentally changed. His relationship with Cersei is strained by his experiences.

relationships.Cersei Lannister: Twin sister and lover, now distant

72.description: Helps Tyrion escape after the trial, revealing the truth about Tysha and permanently damaging their relationship.

relationships.Tywin Lannister: Father Tyrion kills because of his revelation

18.description: Beyond the Wall with the Night's Watch expedition, terrified but trying to do his duty as steward.

33.description: Survives the attack at the Fist of the First Men, fleeing through the wilderness beyond the Wall.

46.description: Kills an Other with an obsidian dagger, earning the name 'Sam the Slayer' though he feels it's undeserved.

relationships.Gilly: Growing closer to the wildling girl

75.description: Orchestrates Jon Snow's election as Lord Commander through clever politicking and vote management.

relationships.Jon Snow: Best friend he helps become Lord Commander

38.description: Prince of Dorne who arrives in King's Landing for Joffrey's wedding. Known for his skill with poison and sexual appetites.

53.description: Reveals his true purpose: seeking justice for his sister Elia's murder by Gregor Clegane during Robert's Rebellion.

relationships.Elia Martell: Sister whose death he wants avenged

77.description: Dies in trial by combat against the Mountain, nearly winning but loses when he demands a confession.

relationships.Gregor Clegane: Kills him but is mortally wounded

42.description: Massive knight in service to Tywin Lannister, known for his cruelty and enormous strength.

77.description: Kills Oberyn Martell in trial by combat but is mortally wounded by poisoned spear. Dies in agony days later.

15.description: Former crow who united the wildling clans into a massive army. Plans to lead his people south of the Wall.

73.description: Leads the massive assault on Castle Black but is ultimately defeated by the Night's Watch defense.

79.description: Captured by Stannis Baratheon and held prisoner. His fate hangs in the balance.

14.description: The King in the North struggling to maintain his war effort while dealing with political challenges and marriage obligations.

28.description: Marries Jeyne Westerling after taking her maidenhead, breaking his betrothal to a Frey girl to maintain his honor.

51.description: Attends Edmure's wedding at the Twins to make amends with House Frey.

26.description: Wildling woman who becomes Jon Snow's lover despite his vows. Teaches him the ways of the free folk.

73.description: Dies during the battle at Castle Black, shot by arrows. Jon finds her dying and holds her as she passes.

60.description: Dies at his own wedding feast, poisoned by wine. His death throws King's Landing into chaos.

relationships.Margaery Tyrell: New wife present at his death

51.description: Hosts Edmure's wedding at the Twins, still bitter about Robb's broken betrothal vow.

11.description: Beautiful young woman who befriends Sansa Stark as part of the Tyrell plan to marry her to Willas.

60.description: Marries King Joffrey but becomes a widow within hours when he dies at their wedding feast.

relationships.Joffrey Baratheon: Husband who dies at their wedding

11.description: Sharp-tongued matriarch of House Tyrell who shows interest in Sansa Stark for political purposes.

63.description: Has a revealing conversation with Sansa about recent events and protecting Margaery.

32.description: Lord of Highgarden and father to Margaery. A proud but not overly bright man manipulated by his mother.
Second son of Mace Tyrell, known for his skill in combat and courteous demeanor.

11.description: Young knight of exceptional beauty and skill, member of the Kingsguard. Brother to Margaery.

4.description: Cruel member of the Kingsguard known for beating Sansa and following Joffrey's orders without question.

relationships.Sansa Stark: Girl he beats on king's orders

4.description: Fat, cowardly member of the Kingsguard who follows orders but lacks true courage or honor.
Member of the Kingsguard who sometimes shows reluctance to follow the cruelest orders.

32.description: New member of the Kingsguard, one of three brothers who serve the crown for gold rather than honor.

21.description: Former maester stripped of his chain for forbidden experiments. Treats Jaime's infected stump.

77.description: Attempts to save Gregor Clegane's life after the trial by combat, using dark arts and forbidden knowledge.

60.description: Gentle young boy whose role changes dramatically after the royal wedding.

4.description: Sweet young princess, daughter of Cersei and sister to Joffrey and Tommen.
Queen Mother who rules through her son Joffrey, paranoid and increasingly isolated after the war.

60.description: Devastated by events at the wedding, immediately suspects Tyrion.

4.description: Elderly Grand Maester who serves the Iron Throne, loyal to House Lannister.
The Spider, master of whispers who claims to serve the realm while playing complex political games.

78.description: Helps Tyrion escape King's Landing after the trial, showing his true loyalties lie elsewhere.

32.description: Lord of Casterly Rock and Hand of the King, orchestrates political marriages to secure Lannister power.

78.description: Shot dead with a crossbow by Tyrion while sitting on his privy, ending the great lord's life ignominiously.

4.description: Tyrion's secret lover, a young woman from Lys who serves as Sansa's maid.

78.description: Found in an unexpected place wearing the Hand's golden chain.

32.description: Tywin's younger brother and most trusted lieutenant, competent administrator and military leader.
Tywin's nephew, a young knight who served as Robert's squire and has secrets about the former king's death.

relationships.Cersei Lannister: Cousin with whom he had relations

4.description: Tyrion's young and loyal squire who saved his life at the Blackwater.
Sellsword turned knight who serves Tyrion for gold rather than honor.

relationships.Cersei Lannister: Buys his loyalty away from Tyrion

11.description: Disgraced knight who serves as the court fool after Sansa saved his life from Joffrey's wrath.

60.description: Helps Sansa escape during the chaos of Joffrey's wedding, revealing he's been working for someone else.

32.description: Minor noble lady who constantly tries to marry her daughter Lollys to any available lord.

relationships.Lollys Stokeworth: Daughter she wants to marry off
relationships.Bronn: Sellsword who eventually marries her daughter

32.description: Simple-minded daughter of Lady Tanda, considered an undesirable match by most lords.
Exiled prince from the Summer Isles who frequents the court seeking support to reclaim his throne.
The court fool, a simple-minded jester who entertains the nobles with his antics.
One of three Kettleblack brothers who serve as sellswords and spies in King's Landing.
Third of the Kettleblack brothers, serves as an officer in the City Watch.

60.description: Gold Cloak who was present during the massacre of Robert's bastards and serves Cersei's interests.

32.description: Honorable knight of the Kingsguard who tries to maintain some dignity in his position.

11.description: Heir to Highgarden, crippled in a jousting accident. The Tyrells plan to marry him to Sansa Stark.

60.description: Minor noble lady attending the Purple Wedding feast.
Distant cousin of House Tyrell present at the royal wedding.

32.description: Septa who serves in the Red Keep.
Master of Coin who orchestrates complex schemes for personal advancement and revenge.

68.description: Reveals he orchestrated Joffrey's murder and takes Sansa to the Vale for his own purposes.

80.description: Sansa's aunt, now married to Littlefinger. Unstable and jealous of any attention he pays to Sansa.
Sickly young Lord of the Vale, Sansa's cousin. Spoiled and prone to fits.

38.description: Bastard daughter of a Dornish lord and paramour of Prince Oberyn Martell.

32.description: The High Septon who performs marriages and oversees religious ceremonies in King's Landing.

60.description: A maester present at court during the Purple Wedding.

18.description: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch who leads the Great Ranging beyond the Wall to investigate wildling movements.

33.description: Killed by his own men in a mutiny at Craster's Keep after the disaster at the Fist of the First Men.

relationships.Craster: Host at whose keep he dies

33.description: Ancient maester of the Night's Watch, blind but wise. Reveals he is a Targaryen prince who gave up his claim.

55.description: Master-at-arms of Castle Black who despises Jon Snow but is a competent defender of the Wall.
Former commander of the City Watch, sent to the Wall by Tyrion. Cowardly and ambitious.

relationships.Tyrion Lannister: Hand who sent him to the Wall

55.description: Lord Steward of the Night's Watch, concerned with practical matters of supplies and logistics.
First Builder of the Night's Watch, responsible for maintaining the Wall and Castle Black.

75.description: Commander of the Shadow Tower, one of the candidates for Lord Commander after Mormont's death.
Commander of Eastwatch-by-the-Sea, another candidate for Lord Commander.

18.description: One of Jon's friends in the Night's Watch, slow but loyal and brave.
Quick-witted friend of Jon Snow, serves as a steward in the Night's Watch.
Gloomy but reliable brother of the Night's Watch known for his pessimistic outlook and dry humor.

33.description: Brutal brother who leads the mutiny that kills Lord Commander Mormont at Craster's Keep.

18.description: Cowardly and cruel brother of the Night's Watch who joins the mutiny at Craster's Keep.
Wildling who lives north of the Wall, keeps many wives who are also his daughters. Ally to the Watch.

33.description: Killed by the mutineers at his own keep after the disaster at the Fist of the First Men.

18.description: Young wildling girl, one of Craster's daughter-wives. Pregnant and desperate to escape.

46.description: Flees with Sam after Craster's murder, carrying her newborn son south of the Wall.

33.description: Mysterious figure who appears to be an undead Night's Watch brother but retains his humanity. Helps Sam and Gilly.

15.description: Mance Rayder's pregnant wife, a wildling woman of strong character.

73.description: Dies in childbirth during the battle at the Wall, leaving behind a son and widowed king.

15.description: Beautiful wildling woman, sister to Mance Rayder's wife Dalla.

79.description: Taken as a captive by Stannis after the battle, becomes a potential marriage prospect.

15.description: Boastful wildling leader and one of Mance Rayder's chief lieutenants, known for his tall tales.
Wildling raider who wears armor made of bones and leads his own band of followers.
Notorious wildling raider known for his cruelty and the tears tattooed on his face.
Female wildling leader who commands her own band and is known for her ferocity.

26.description: Leader of the Thenns, a more organized and disciplined tribe of wildlings who practice cannibalism.

15.description: Wildling skinchanger who can control multiple animals, one of Mance's most valuable allies.

26.description: Wildling skinchanger who can warg into his eagle. Jealous of Jon's relationship with Ygritte.

48.description: Killed by Jon Snow when he tries to prevent Jon's escape back to Castle Black.

45.description: Brother to Catelyn Stark and heir to Riverrun. Set to marry a Frey girl to repair the alliance.

51.description: Marries Roslin Frey at the Twins in a tense ceremony.

45.description: Young Frey daughter chosen to marry Edmure Tully. One of the more pleasant Frey children.

51.description: Marries Edmure at the Twins. Genuinely fond of her husband.

relationships.Walder Frey: Father who uses her marriage for betrayal

14.description: Lord of the Dreadfort and one of Robb's bannermen, known for his quiet demeanor and cruel practices.

51.description: Attends the wedding at the Twins with his own agenda.
Bastard son of Walder Frey present at the wedding.

45.description: Intelligent but physically impaired son of Walder Frey, involved in wedding planning.
Another bastard son of Walder Frey, present at the wedding.
One of the many Frey sons, not particularly distinguished but participates in family schemes.
Eldest son of Walder Frey and heir to the Twins, present at the wedding.

51.description: Grandson of Walder Frey, son of Ryman, present at the wedding.
Simple-minded grandson of Walder Frey who serves as a fool. Catelyn kills him in desperation.
Large granddaughter of Walder Frey, married to Roose Bolton.

9.description: Lord who leads the Brotherhood Without Banners, resurrected multiple times by Thoros of Myr.

30.description: Killed in single combat by the Hound but resurrected again, showing his divine protection.

9.description: Red priest who follows R'hllor and has the power to resurrect Beric Dondarrion from death.
Skilled archer who serves in the Brotherhood Without Banners, known for his exceptional aim.
Member of the Brotherhood Without Banners known for his distinctive yellow cloak.
Minstrel and spy for the Brotherhood Without Banners, uses his music to gather information.
Former guardsman of Winterfell who now serves with the Brotherhood, recognizes Arya.

relationships.Arya Stark: Stark girl he knew at Winterfell

9.description: Tyroshi member of the Brotherhood Without Banners, distinguished by his dyed green beard.

22.description: Former Kingsguard who fled King's Landing after the Battle of the Blackwater, now a wanted man.

74.description: Left to die by Arya after being wounded in a fight, his fate uncertain.

relationships.Arya Stark: Girl who refuses to kill him

1.description: Tall, powerful woman knight sworn to Catelyn Stark, tasked with escorting Jaime Lannister south.

74.description: Defeats the Hound in single combat while searching for the Stark girls, showing her martial prowess.

21.description: Leader of the Brave Companions, a sellsword company. Orders Jaime's hand cut off.

31.description: Bolton man-at-arms who escorts Jaime from Harrenhal to King's Landing.

28.description: Northern lord seeking vengeance for his sons' deaths, murders Lannister prisoners against Robb's orders.

relationships.Jaime Lannister: Man he blames for sons' deaths

34.description: Executed by Robb Stark for murdering prisoners, costing Robb crucial support.

14.description: Massive lord of Last Hearth and one of Robb's most loyal and boisterous supporters.

51.description: Present at the wedding when chaos erupts.
Son of the Greatjon, present at the wedding.
Son of Lord Wyman Manderly, attends the wedding.
Daughter of Bear Island, one of Robb's guards at the wedding.

28.description: Daughter of a minor Westerlands lord whom Robb marries after taking her maidenhead, breaking his Frey betrothal.

51.description: Not present at the wedding, remains at Riverrun.

38.description: Prince of Dorne and elder brother to Oberyn, known for his cautious and patient approach to politics.

53.description: Oberyn's sister and Rhaegar Targaryen's wife, murdered by Gregor Clegane during Robert's Rebellion.

70.description: Eldest of Oberyn's bastard daughters, known for her skill with spear and whip.
Second of Oberyn's bastard daughters, beautiful and deadly like her father.
Third of Oberyn's bastard daughters, sweet-faced but skilled with poisons like her father.
Fourth of Oberyn's bastard daughters, scholarly and curious.
Fifth of Oberyn's bastard daughters, named after her aunt.
Sixth of Oberyn's bastard daughters, still young.
Seventh of Oberyn's bastard daughters, one of the younger Sand Snakes.
Youngest of Oberyn's bastard daughters, still a child.

38.description: Daughter and heir of Prince Doran, beautiful and ambitious princess of Dorne.
Younger son of Prince Doran, sent away for fostering and political purposes.
Youngest son of Prince Doran, betrothed to Princess Myrcella.
Captain of guards to Prince Doran, a Norvoshi warrior with a longaxe.
Maester serving House Martell in Sunspear.
Bastard knight who accompanies Oberyn to King's Landing as part of his entourage.
Knight of House Dalt who serves in Oberyn's entourage to King's Landing.
Knight of House Uller in Oberyn's party traveling to King's Landing.
Lord of Hellholt, one of the Dornish nobles loyal to House Martell.
Lord of Yronwood, one of the most powerful vassals of House Martell.
Aged lord of Skyreach, warden of the Prince's Pass.
Lord of Kingsgrave, another of Dorne's important vassals.

74.description: Mysterious Faceless Man who gave Arya the iron coin that grants her passage to Braavos.

82.description: Braavosi ship captain who gives Arya passage to Braavos when she shows him the iron coin.

relationships.Jaqen H'ghar: Faceless Man whose coin she carries

23.description: Unsullied commander chosen by lot to lead the eunuch warriors serving Daenerys.
Young scribe and translator from Naath who serves Daenerys after being freed from slavery.
Good Master of Astapor who sells Daenerys the Unsullied, only to be burned alive by her dragon.

42.description: Wise Master of Yunkai who negotiates with Daenerys for the city's surrender.
Tyroshi sellsword captain who betrays his company to join Daenerys, bringing her the heads of his fellow captains.

68.description: Becomes Daenerys's lover and one of her most trusted commanders in Meereen.

42.description: Ghiscari captain of the Second Sons, killed by Daario when he switches sides.
Co-captain of the Second Sons, killed by Daario when he betrays the company.

23.description: Former fighting slave from Meereen who serves Daenerys, massive eunuch who loves to fight.
Former Lord Commander of the Kingsguard, dismissed by Joffrey, now disguised as 'Arstan Whitebeard' serving Daenerys.

68.description: Reveals his true identity to Daenerys and becomes her most trusted advisor on Westerosi politics.

8.description: Exiled knight who serves as Daenerys's most loyal advisor and protector, secretly in love with her.

68.description: Young nobleman of Meereen who speaks for the former masters and seeks accommodation with Daenerys.
Former slave who becomes Daenerys's seneschal in Meereen, helps run the city's administration.
Meereenese noble who shaves his head in rejection of traditional ways and serves Daenerys loyally.
High priestess of the Temple of the Graces in Meereen, speaks for the traditional religious order.

8.description: Largest and most aggressive of Daenerys's three dragons, named after her deceased husband Khal Drogo.
Green dragon named after Daenerys's brother Rhaegar, one of her three children.
Cream and gold dragon named after Daenerys's brother Viserys, gentlest of her three dragons.

78.description: Wealthy magister of Pentos who helps Tyrion escape from King's Landing via Varys's network.

82.description: Powerful figure in Braavos who controls much of the city's trade and criminal activity.
Massive statue that guards the entrance to Braavos, through whose legs ships must pass.

4.description: Elegant proprietress of an upscale brothel in King's Landing, from the Summer Isles.
Beautiful daughter of Chataya who works in her mother's establishment.

80.description: Maester serving House Arryn at the Eyrie, tends to Lord Robert's health.
Knight of House Belmore, one of the Vale lords who serves House Arryn.
Powerful lord of Runestone, one of the most important vassals in the Vale.

relationships.Waymar Royce: Son who died beyond the Wall

80.description: Knight of House Royce, cousin to Bronze Yohn, serves as High Steward of the Vale.
Dangerous knight of House Corbray who wields the Valyrian steel sword Lady Forlorn.
Lord of Heart's Home, elder brother to Lyn Corbray.
Lord of Strongsong, one of the Vale's noble houses.
Elderly lord of Redfort, one of the Vale's ancient houses.
Young lord of Longbow Hall, one of the Vale nobles.
Knight of House Templeton, one of the Vale's lesser but proud houses.
Elderly lady of Ironoaks, one of the few female lords in the Vale.
Knight of House Waynwood, son or relative of Lady Anda.

73.description: Claimant to the Iron Throne who arrives at the Wall to defeat the wildling army and capture Mance Rayder.

79.description: Offers to legitimize Jon Snow and make him Lord of Winterfell if he bends the knee, but Jon refuses.

73.description: Red priestess from Asshai who serves Stannis and follows R'hllor, the Lord of Light.

79.description: Shows interest in Jon Snow, claiming to see important things about him in her fires.

relationships.Jon Snow: Man she sees in the flames

79.description: Former smuggler turned knight who serves as Stannis's most trusted advisor and friend.
Stannis's wife from House Florent, a fervent follower of the Lord of Light.
Stannis's young daughter, scarred by greyscale but intelligent and kind.

51.description: Roose Bolton's bastard son, known for his extreme cruelty and sadistic nature.

13.description: Stark boy with growing powers of warging and greensight, travels north seeking the three-eyed crow.

81.description: Reaches the cave beyond the Wall where the three-eyed crow awaits, beginning his mystical training.

13.description: Simple-minded stable boy who can only say 'Hodor', carries Bran on their journey north.
Young crannogman with greensight who guides Bran north to find the three-eyed crow.
Skilled crannogwoman who protects Bran with her net, spear, and hunting skills.
Bran's direwolf, shares a deep bond with him through warging.

56.description: Youngest Stark child who goes into hiding with Osha rather than continue the dangerous journey north.

13.description: Rickon's black direwolf, wild and aggressive like his young master.
Wildling spearwife who serves the Starks, practical and protective of the children.

81.description: Ancient being merged with a weirwood tree who has been calling to Bran through his dreams.
One of the Children of the Forest who helps Bran reach the three-eyed crow.

13.description: Ancient servant of Winterfell, Hodor's great-grandmother who told the Stark children stories.

51.description: Lord of White Harbor whose son Wendel attended the wedding.

13.description: Lord of Greywater Watch, father to Jojen and Meera, fought alongside Ned Stark at the Tower of Joy.
Former master-at-arms of Winterfell, killed by Theon when he took the castle.
Former maester of Winterfell, killed when Theon took the castle, loved the Stark children.
Septon of Winterfell, killed when Theon took the castle.
Kennelmaster of Winterfell, killed when Theon took the castle.
Serving girl at Winterfell who was killed or fled when Theon took the castle.
Blacksmith of Winterfell, killed when Theon took the castle.
Simple-minded man from a village near Winterfell who joins Bran's group.
Village man who follows Bran's group, named for his squinting eyes.

51.description: Bastard knight who serves Robb Stark at the wedding.
Northern lord present at the wedding.
Young northern lord who attends the wedding.

45.description: One of Walder Frey's many sons, attends the wedding massacre.
Another of Walder Frey's sons, named after Lord Hoster Tully.
Knight in service to House Frey, attends the wedding betrayal.
Knight from a family allied to the Freys, present at the wedding conspiracy.
Another Haigh knight allied with the Freys in their betrayal.
Member of House Haigh present at the wedding massacre.
One of the many Frey sons who participates in the family's betrayal.
Another son of Walder Frey present at the massacre.
Son of Walder Frey married to Genna Lannister, making him Tywin's brother-in-law.
Sister to Tywin Lannister, married to Emmon Frey, connecting the houses.

1.description: Son of Emmon Frey and Genna Lannister, travels with Jaime as prisoner exchange.

21.description: Killed by outlaws while traveling with Jaime and Brienne.

32.description: Young Lannister cousin who disappeared during the riot in King's Landing, presumed dead.
Lannister cousin and knight, one of the family's military leaders.
Another Lannister cousin serving in the family's forces.
Knight of House Marbrand who serves as a commander in the Lannister forces.
Knight of House Prester in service to the Lannisters.
Powerful knight of House Crakehall known for his strength and size.
Knight of House Greenfield serving in the Lannister forces.
Knight serving House Lannister in their military campaigns.
Knight of House Brax from the Westerlands, serves the Lannisters.
Another knight of House Brax serving in Lannister forces.
Knight of House Lefford, one of the Westerlands houses serving Tywin.
Knight serving in the Lannister forces during the War of Five Kings.
Distant cousin of the main Lannister line, serves in their military.

9.description: Member of the Brotherhood Without Banners, one of the outlaws fighting for justice.
Another outlaw in the Brotherhood Without Banners, fights alongside Beric.
Member of the Brotherhood Without Banners with a reputation for luck.
Outlaw of the Brotherhood, known for his supposed good fortune.
Former miller who joined the Brotherhood after his mill was burned in the war.
Archer in the Brotherhood Without Banners, serves under Anguy.
Member of the Brotherhood Without Banners, fights for justice in the Riverlands.

14.description: Last knight of House Darry, serves Robb Stark despite his house's destruction.

45.description: One of Walder Frey's many daughters present at the wedding.
Another Frey daughter attending Edmure's wedding at the Twins.
Walder Frey's daughter, present at the wedding that becomes a massacre.
Young Frey girl, granddaughter of Walder Frey.
Member of House Vance present at Edmure's wedding.
One of Walder Frey's sons who attends the wedding betrayal.
Another son of Walder Frey present at the massacre.
Son of Walder Frey who takes part in the Red Wedding betrayal.
One of the many Frey sons present at the wedding massacre.
Another Frey son involved in the betrayal of the Stark forces.
Son of Walder Frey who attends the wedding massacre.
Knight of House Frey present at the betrayal of their Stark guests.
Another son of Walder Frey involved in the wedding massacre.
Son of Walder Frey present at the wedding betrayal.
One of Walder Frey's sons who takes part in the massacre.
Another son of Walder Frey present at the wedding betrayal.
Son of Walder Frey present at the wedding massacre.
Knight of House Frey who participates in the betrayal of their guests.
Son of Walder Frey present at the wedding massacre.
Knight of House Frey present at the betrayal.
Another son of Walder Frey who takes part in the massacre.
Son of Walder Frey present at the wedding betrayal.
One of the many sons of Walder Frey present at the massacre.
Son of Walder Frey who attends the wedding betrayal.

9.description: Member of the Brotherhood Without Banners, a common man fighting for justice.
Outlaw of the Brotherhood Without Banners fighting against injustice in the Riverlands.
Young member of the Brotherhood Without Banners, known for his lack of facial hair.

45.description: Son of Walder Frey present at the wedding betrayal.
Another son of Walder Frey present at the massacre.
Son of Walder Frey who takes part in the Red Wedding betrayal.
One of the many Frey sons involved in the massacre.
Son of Walder Frey present at the wedding betrayal.
Daughter of Walder Frey present at Edmure's wedding.
Another daughter of Walder Frey at the wedding massacre.
Walder Frey's daughter present at the wedding.
One of Walder Frey's daughters at the wedding betrayal.
Daughter of Walder Frey present at Edmure's wedding.
Another of Walder Frey's daughters at the Red Wedding.
Walder Frey's daughter present at the wedding massacre.
One of the many Frey daughters at the Red Wedding.
Daughter of Walder Frey present at Edmure's wedding.
Another Frey daughter at the wedding betrayal.
Walder Frey's daughter present at the wedding massacre.

recaps.1: Jaime Lannister travels as prisoner with Catelyn Stark and Brienne of Tarth.
recaps.2: The war continues with various factions maneuvering for advantage.
recaps.3: Tyrion deals with political challenges in King's Landing after the Blackwater.

recaps.6: Jon continues his infiltration of the wildlings beyond the Wall.
recaps.7: Catelyn travels with Robb's army as the war continues.
recaps.8: Daenerys begins building her power with ships and dragons.
recaps.9: Arya travels with the Brotherhood Without Banners. Jaime begins his journey south.

recaps.31: Jaime's journey continues as he deals with his maiming.
